content:
I’m a computational biologist currently based at the University of Melbourne Centre for Cancer Research where I study rare neuroendocrine tumours. My background is in genetics, however upon starting my research journey I quickly discovered my passion for biological data analysis and transitioned from bench work to bioinformatics.
My research interests include genetic dysregulation in cancer and developmental biology. I specialise in analysis of single-cell genomics data and also have experience analysing bulk transcriptomic and epigenomic datasets. I use (mostly) R, as well as Bash and Python. I particularly enjoy data visualisation and creating nice plots to share findings.
  Download my resumé.
summary: I’m a computational biologist currently based at the University of Melbourne Centre for Cancer Research where I study rare neuroendocrine tumours. My background is in genetics, however upon starting my research journey I quickly discovered my passion for biological data analysis and transitioned from bench work to bioinformatics.
title: Blake Bowen

content:
Introduction I have been working on single nuclei RNA-seq and single nuclei ATAC-seq data for about the last year and a half. This is a compilation of resources I have found very helpful throughout this time. I use the (Seurat)[https://satijalab.org/seurat/index.html] single cell toolkit for my analyses so this list is slighlty biased toward resources that use either Seurat or complementary tools.
Tutorials Cellranger \
These tutorials cover how to use Cellranger. The Cellranger pipeline is used to process the raw 10x Genomics Chromium single-cell RNA-seq output into a gene expression matrix.
Seurat guided clustering tutorial For downstream analysis, the best place to start is the vignettes published by the (Satija Lab)[https://satijalab.org/], the authors of Seurat. These tutorials provide an overview of the methods and can be used as an initial analysis framework that can be modified to analyse new datasets. \
HBC Single cell RNA-seq data analysis workshop This workshop made by the Harvard Chan Bioinformatics Core has freely available workshop materials. These workshops provide an in-depth overview of single cell analysis.
Papers Packages Other Online Resources Seurat Cheatsheet Orchestrating single-cell analysis book (bioconductor)
summary: Introduction I have been working on single nuclei RNA-seq and single nuclei ATAC-seq data for about the last year and a half. This is a compilation of resources I have found very helpful throughout this time.
title: Useful resources for single cell RNA-seq analysis:

content: Pheochromocytomas and paragangliomas (PCPG) are rare neuroendocrine tumors with high heritability and genetic diversity. This study comprised a comprehensive single nuclei RNA-seq analysis of 30 PCPG and two adult adrenal medulla tissues. Additionally, a large compendium of bulk gene expression data (Microarray and RNA-seq) was integrated to enable discovery and characterisation of novel subtypes and validation of the single nuclei data.
summary: Comprehensive analysis of Pheochromocytoma and Paraganglioma at single cell resolution.
title: snRNA-seq atlas of pheochromocytoma and paraganglioma
